title: Talking to a hospital patient
context: Comfort a friend or family member who is lying in a hospital bed.

content.bestLine: You're going to be okay, I'm here for you

neutral.text: I'll stay with you for a while
You're doing great, keep it up
I'm so glad I could visit you

informal.text: I've got your back, don't worry
I'm here to hang out and keep you company
What can I get for you?
You're strong and capable, you got this
I'm so happy to see you smiling

formal.text: I hope you're receiving the best care possible
Please let me know if there's anything I can do for you
You're in a wonderful hospital with great staff
I'll be happy to assist you in any way I can
Your health and well-being are my top priority

patterns.template: You're [options] and I'm here for you
I'm [options] you're receiving the best care
patterns.meaning: expressing positive sentiments about the patient's care
